page.title: 01East Manchester GR:03880396
page.content: The area included in the survey covers the east part of Manchester (Higher Openshaw,Gorton and Denton) and the south side of Tameside (Droylsden). The land is gently undulating and largely urban with both residential and industrial landuse. Some of the old industries remain but many of the heavy engineering (locomotives) and iron and steel works have gone. Manchester Steel remains at Openshaw but is due to close in 1986. A pool of skilled and semi-skilled labour remains in the area. The region is criss-crossed by different transport networks, old and new, reminders of an early, thriving industrial growth, and more recent urban renewal and landscaping. Subsumed within the conurbation, the old centres have retained their sense of identity and community.
